page.title: 07Home Life in Sydling
page.content: For the working population of Sydling home life starts early in the morning. People who have jobs have long journeys to make to their place of work. Children have to catch the School bus which leaves Cross Tree at about 8 am. For the rest who work in the village, the builders, decorators, plumbers, electricians, cleaners, hairdressers and the farmers, most of them make early starts. This leaves the elderly and the recently retired population to get up in their own time. The Post Office opens from nine until 5pm with an hour off for lunch, 3 days a week. The Greyhound Pub opens from 11.30am until 2.30pm and from 6.30pm until 10.30pm each evening. They serve food and have limited accomodation for guests.
